This is a good game, B. 

Pros: It's physics based combat and the intense feel is like nothing else I have seen. These groundbreaking 2004 graphics would fit in with the best of at least 2011. The sound mixing was great as well. Great puzzle aspect.

OK aspects: The story really was not too well thought out and there wasn't really too much of it; however it was very well paced.

Cons: The combat is definitely repetitive even though there is decent AI. The voice acting was very bad. For the most part, a bad use of location. This game has an absolutely horrendous soundtrack.

He is telling you what you must do for your mission. Eventually once you've completely woken up, you find your self on a tram system that is pulling into this well secured station. From there Freeman is running for his life to escape the Combine that are trying to kill him. Once you've escaped the area you find Alex, your friend that helps you throughout the story line. Alex brings you to where her father and a scientist are plotting to take out the Combine. The Combine find where you are and then you are on the run agian. Near the end of the story you get a look at what the Combine do to people who resist them. They show no mercy. Last, you arive at the cydidal and ignite an explosion to bring it down. I rate this 10/10.

Half-Life 2 offers everything that is awesome about the original Half-Life game only going several steps further. The game takes place sometime after Gordon Freeman accepted a deal from the mysterious G-Man, Gordon had encountered throughout the Black Mesa lab facility during the Xem alien invasion. The G-Man appeared to know more about the situation at Black Mesa than he's leading on to. After that ill fated day Gordon awakens from a status sleep mode and is once again greeted by the G-Man who gives Gordon a trippy light show straight out of the Twilight Zone opening. After the G-Man giving out his monologe, Gordon soon finds himself on a train accompanied by people all wearing the same clothing. The train docks at what appears to be a city but not like any city Gordon has ever visited or seen before. He knows it is Earth and not the Xem planet, because most of the posters and signs are in European text. The city itself is called "City 17" an enclosed society with marshall law as a form of enforcement as there are various security cameras, hover cameras, weaponized mechas, armored swat like policemen, force fields, & tanks. As Gordon wonders through the train station and soon the city itself, he feels alienated as he apparently has been gone from Earth much longer than expected. While trying to make sense of things, he soon finds himself being chased by the police during a raid taking place in an appartment building. When all seem lost for Gordon, he is saved by a woman name Alyx who is the daughter of Dr. Eli Vance whom Gordon knew from Black Mesa. Alyx leads Gordon to a hidden base being opperated by a group of freedom fighters who all want to be freed by the Combine, the organization that is controlled by the Xem that enslaved the entire planet after the Black Mesa incident occured. Gordon immediately makes a few new friends and even meets some of the last surviving Black Mesa staff members who are all more than happy to see Gordon alive and well. After the introductions and reunion Gordon learns about the situation of the city and how to help the freedom fighters win their freedom. The main goal is to destroy the Combine's main base of operations in the center of the city which leads Gordon into a long journey ahead. But with the use of his EMV suit that he reacquires and the assortment of weapons nothing will stand in his or his friend's way towards freedom. Half-Life 2 has so much to offer that I don't know where to start. Well first of all the graphics are improved up a notch and the glitches that were in the first game are no where in site. The enviroments are huge and vast, I could just spend hours sinking in all that is offered in site. The new characters are as great as well as the returning ones, Alyx is a great addition to the franchise someone in which the female fan base can immediately associate with. The method of killing enemies are the same as in the original as with the vast assortment of weapons you have multiple ways to kill certain enemies. The plot contains elements straight outta the novel 1984, the films the Matrix, THX-1138, Alien, The Thing, & The Fly. Every minute of this game I enjoyed to the fulliest, if you liked the original Half-Life then you'll love this game even more. It's proof that a game's sequel can be better than the original and this one takes that title. Half-Life 2 is what legends are made of. I might be ranting on about it for too long, but I am dead serious. The game is more than a high recommendation, it is mandatory you play this game. You have not lived life to its fullest until you have played this game.

不要看負評,快買這款遊戲,不過我說Valve...那個三代呢?

1990年代末傳奇FPS遊戲再一次引起波瀾,遊戲英雄「鐵撬博士」高登弗里曼重回拯救人類
與同時期紛紛出籠的近代指標性的FPS遊戲,酷炫的介面與浩瀚的場景演示相比;Half-Life 2保持90年代old school一貫的沉默主角,遊戲劇情都以可控式劇本分鏡來推展,謎題也沒有明確的介面提示目前該做甚麼
但這不代表Half-Life 2缺乏畫面表現,以當時來看souce引擎的表現可圈可點

在劇本來說投入相當的心力作表現,許多細節也經過深思熟慮,這些可以在之後的製作人員說明模式中看到valve的用心
雖然在valve的STEAM底下有自賣自誇之嫌,但Half-Life 2的確有呈現用心製作遊戲的正面心態
這是許多金玉其外敗絮其內,只問外觀華麗不論品質,只把遊戲當作賣錢的商品,好賣再說不好賣就擺爛的拋棄式經營大作應該好好效法Half-Life 2[spoiler](對,Division他媽的我就是在說你)[/spoiler]
